amendment.description: Amendment requires States, in order to receive Federal funds, to certify that prospective parents have been adequately prepared to provide for the needs of a child.
amendment.purpose: An amendment no. 2 and printed in H. Rept. 106-199 to require states to certify in their plans that prospective foster parents are being adequately trained.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Thompson (CA) amendment (A002) Agreed to by voice vote.
